title: World's most scenic airport landings - 2015 [Photos]
text:
Friday, August 21, 2015 08:00 AM EDT World's most scenic airport landings - 2015 Previous Next 
A poll from private charter jet providers Privatefly.com has revealed the world's most scenic airport landings for 2015. From the gorgeous -- like the scenic Queenstown Airport in New Zealand -- to the unusual -- like St. Maarten's landing over the beach -- these 10 airports runways provide passengers with breathtaking sights when landing. 1. Queenstown Airport, New Zealand. Views: This scenic flight to the resort town of Queenstown gives travellers views of mountains and the New Zealand country. (Fotolia) 
2. Las Vegas Mccarran Airport, Nevada. Views: The Las Vegas Strip, plus surrounding desert and mountains. (Fotolia) 
3. Nice Cote D'Azur Airport, France. Views: Provides views of the French Riviera and Monaco when landing. (Courtesy Aéroport Nice Côte d'Azur Facebook ) 
4. Barra Airport, Scotland. Views: The beach is the runway at Barra Airport, which offers stunning views of the Outer Hebrides and the bay of Traigh Mhor. ( Sue Jackson/Wikipedia ) 
5. St. Maarten Princess Juliana International Airport, Caribbean. Views: Planes fly low over Maho Beach to land at Princess Juliana Airport just across the street. (Fotolia) 
6. Saba Airport, Juancho E Yrausquin, Caribbean. Views: The only airport on the island of Saba is bordered by high hills that drop into the sea on either side. (Fotolia) 
7. Billy Bishop Airport, Toronto. Views: Excellent views over Lake Ontario, the Toronto Islands and downtown Toronto itself. (Fotolia) 
8. Gibraltar International Airport, British Territory. Views: A gorgeous sea view is magical for some flyers -- for others, the runway that extends into the water is a little too terrifying. (Fotolia) 
9. London City Airport, U.K. Views: London's Canary Wharf, Docklands and general views of England's capital city. (Courtesy London City Airport Facebook ) 
10. Cape Town Airport, South Africa Views: Incredible views of Table Mountain can be seen upon descent. (Fotolia)
